dialogues.text: You're flak happy. We took a big chance on you. Just do your job and shut up! He doesn't take the ring. He brushes past Phil and goes up the hatch to the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val stands on the narrow catwalk running the length of the bay. There are eight bombs, four on each side -- olive drab bombs with three thin yellow bands. Val eases the cotter pin from the nose of one of the bombs. He looks at the bomb, then pats it a little as if to calm it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is helping Rascal drop down into the ball turret through the entry hatch.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Rascal, there's nothing wrong with the turret.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Don't worry your pretty head about it, Virge.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: I'm just doing my job. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Now you do it. Thanks a lot. Rascal disappears into the turret. Virge closes the hatch on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal is curled into the womb-like turret. His legs are spread and his feet are set on pedals which control the movement of the turret. There are small windows on each side and one large circular window of armored glass in front. He has no room at all. It's claustrophobic. At the same time, the turret is insubstantial, as if Rascal weren't in the plane at all, just tenuously clinging to its belly. He presses the foot pedals, spinning the turret around, testing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead and slightly above the Belle is the first flight: Windy City in the center, Mama's Boys on its left, C Cup on its right. Luke is fastening his oxygen mask.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: We're at ten thousand feet. Let's hear your oxygen checks. Clay, how are you doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay is kneeling in front of his twin guns, looking down on the formation spread out above and below. Planes for miles. He fastens his oxygen mask tight over his nose and mouth, then checks the gauge to make sure oxygen is flowing.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY
dialogues.text: (sings) 'Don't worry 'bout me, I'll get along...!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his map, Phil has drawn a line from Bassingbourn, near Cambridge, northeast to Swaffham. Now he extends the line from Swaffham east to Great Yarmouth, on the British coast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Captain, we're exactly five miles south southwest of Great Yarmouth. This is the rally point. We're in formation.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, we're on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we see the Memphis Belle, flying steady and level. Then we PULL BACK to see its two wingmen, Baby Ruth and Mother and Country flying tight on the left and right. We CONTINUE PULLING BACK FURTHER AND FURTHER, REVEALING more and more planes -- B-17s stacked up all over the sky The formation is composed of three groups, each group containing eighteen planes. Memphis Belle is in the first group. Within the first group there are three squadrons: high, lead and low. Memphis Belle is in the lead squadron. The high squadron is above it, behind and to the left. The low squadron is below and to the right. Each squadron consists of six planes, divided into two flights. The first flight flies above and ahead of the second. In our squadron, the first flight is Windy City, Mama's Boys and C Cup. Memphis Belle is the lead plane of the second flight, with Baby Ruth and Mother and Country as its left and right wingmen. Altogether, there are nearly 500 planes in the air, a majestic sight. Contrails -- wide, beautiful strips of vapor -- are streaming from their engines. Below, the deep green land ends in a white coastline. From then on, nothing but grey sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Eugene are at their guns, watching the sky tensely for fighters. Dennis's voice comes over the INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Listen, men, I'm showing thirty below zero up here, so keep your gloves on. Don't touch your gun with your bare hands or you'll freeze right to it. I don't want anyone losing any fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny carefully wraps the champagne bottle in an extra blue heated suit, sets it carefully on the floor under his desk, and plugs the socket into the outlet on the wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And keep checking your masks for frozen saliva. That stuff gets down there and blocks up your oxygen flow. The last thing I need is someone passing out on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal spins the TURRET around, testing it. It turns smoothly, with a high HYDRAULIC WHINE. He raises and lowers his guns. He's still worried about the turret, almost trying to find something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: In short, don't drool.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In short, check your masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil takes off his watch and sets it down on top of his maps, where other items are laid out: his dog tags, rabbit's foot, class ring and baseball cards which have black and white photos of the Yankees on them. He's trying to decide who gets what. Val is in the front of the nose, checking the bombsight.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Keep the intercom free and call out those fighters. Make it short and sweet.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is for Virge. No, Clay. This is for Virge.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And don't shout. We can hear you loud and clear. Let's make this our best run yet. One we can really be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Right in the pickle barrel, huh, Dennis?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Only in the pickle barrel. Keep your minds on your job, work together and stay alert.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay has dropped off to sleep. He has fashioned a little pillow from an extra pair of long johns and lodged it between his head and the fuselage wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is tuning his RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Captain, I'm getting Gracie Allen here. Can I put her on?

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Please, sir!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: All right, Dennis. But when I say that's enough... Danny flips a switch. The voices of GEORGE BURNS and GRACIE ALLEN are clear.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ... My family is putting on a back yard circus, just like we did when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Every spring you kids used to put on your own circus?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Of course, admission was free, but that was only for people who could afford it. Audience laughter. Danny laughs, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is still trying to figure out who gets what. He has added a fountain pen and an air medal to the collection.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Aunt Gertrude was the snake charmer.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Aunt Gertrude? The one who's so nearsighted? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Clay... Bugene... Jack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is slowly rotating his turret, anxiously watching the blue sky through the Plexiglas bubble.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes. She had a little snake and she was supposed to put it in a basket and then blow on a flute until the snake stuck its head up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is behind his gun, watching the sky and eager to get into action. Eugene has made a sign on the back of an old flimsy and now puts two pieces of electrical tape on it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And what do you suppose happened one Saturday afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She put the flute in the basket and blew on the snake.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Wasn't that awful! Jack laughs. Eugene laughs with Jack and slaps him on the back, attaching the sign without Jack knowing it. It reads, "COULDN'T GET LAID LAST NIGHT!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud burst of STATIC. Danny adjusts the RADIO, but the static won't go away.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was the lion tamer. Of course, I just used our house cat... The voice disappears. Danny fiddles with the dials some more. The signal returns, but very faintly.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But when she got in front of the audience she forgot all her tricks and just had kittens... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The voices disappear again. This time Danny can't get them back -- there's only STATIC. Disappointed, Danny switches the RADIO OFF. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay, test your guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal spins the turret as he FIRES. The vibration of the GUNS rattles the turret and goes right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene and Jack FIRE out of their two open windows. SHELL CASINGS SPIT out onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil and Val FIRE their GUNS -- Phil on the left side, Val on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay wakes up in a panic. He grabs his gun and looks around for fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge stops firing his guns. He puts up a hand to shield his eyes from the bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Little friends, three o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-47 Thunderbolts streak across the sky above the formation, like fat hummingbirds. They're careful not to point their noses at or fly directly into the for- mation to avoid being mistaken for enemy aircraft. These one-seat fighters have a single propeller mounted in a round, blunt nose with a white ring around the cowling. They have eight machine gun barrels, four on each wing. They zoom effortlessly through the air at 300 m.p.h. and can perform dazzling acrobatics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke watches as one of the Thunderbolts zips by on the far side of Mother and Country. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'd give anything to fly a Thunderbolt. You're all alone, you can do anything you want. That's flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is here, with Jack and Eugene. He has a small, light oxygen tank slung over his shoulder on a strap. It has eight minutes of air in it. Whenever the men move around the plane for any length of time, they use these little tanks, taking a hit of oxygen when they need it. Both Jack and Eugene have their masks off to talk. Phil hands Eugene a fountain pen.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: It's the best pen money can buy.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Why can't I have the baseball cards?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: They're for Jack. Here, Jack. He hands Jack the baseball cards. Jack looks longingly at the fountain pen.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'm really more of a football fan myself. Angrily, Phil grabs the pen from Eugene, thrusts it at Jack, then takes the cards and gives them to Eugene. He shouts at them.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Happy? He turns and stomps out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is changing the film in his camera when he hears the ROOKIE'S VOICE on the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Mother and Country calling Memphis Belle. Come in. Danny flips a switch on the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Read you, Mother. What's wrong? Danny looks out his right window. Mother and Country can be seen, flying very close. We might even see the Rookie's head.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nothing, Danny, I just had a question.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We're not supposed to use the radio unless it's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. It was just about my log book, whether I should write down every radio communication I hear or just...

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Write down everything at first. Then later on... Look, we better sign off.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay. Thanks, Danny. I won't bother you again. Danny has wound his camera. He stands up and aims it out the right radio room window.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I'm taking your picture. Smile. Danny snaps the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil extends the line on his map out across the North Sea. His hand shakes and the line goes wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We're getting close to enemy territory. Be on guard. Call out those fighters soon as you see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is alert, tense, checking the sky for fighters. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He checks from eight to ten o'clock, high and low. He still isn't aware of the sign on his back. Eugene also watches the sky, nervously. His duty is two o'clock to four o'clock, high and low.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Clay, you really sang great last night. You should do like we keep saying. After the war go to to Hollywood and get a record contract like Frank Sinatra.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, so we can say we knew you when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay has a bird's eye view of the formation, spread out in perfect "Vs" across the sky. It's a spectacular sight. Clay is whittling his model plane. He looks up occasionally for fighters -- his area is mainly four to eight o'clock low.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY
dialogues.text: Nah. I'm gonna get a nice little farm and a nice little wife and settle down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is intently flying the plane. Luke is, as usual, sitting beside him with nothing to do.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Luke's the one should go to Hollywood. He could star in the movies.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Maybe, maybe. I don't know what I'm going to do after the war. Except not work.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, Luke, why go back to the daily grind of being a lifeguard? Take it easy! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I know exactly what I'm going to do.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Virge, if I hear one more word about that stupid restaurant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is slowly turning in his turret, watching the upper sky, all hours of the clock.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: It's not stupid! At least I've got a plan. What are you going to do after the war, Rascal?

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Come to your restaurant and rob it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is behind his gun on the right front side of the nose. He's searching the sky, twelve to three o'clock high and low. Phil is on his gun on the left side, checking the sky nine to twelve, high and low.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Val's the smart one. He's almost a doctor already. What kind of doctor are you going to be, Val?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: A rich one. What about Phil? What should he be after the war? Nerves on edge, Phil looks at Val.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Wait. I've got it. <A mortician! Val cackles with laughter. Phil doesn't think it's funny at all. He turns away.  146 147 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above and ahead, the first flight can be seen, still streaming contrails from their engines.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Fellas, think about this. My family has a furniture business. We make furniture, sell it. You can all come work for me. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Like I said, don't give it a thought.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: That's just what we need, you ordering us around the rest of our lives. 'Do the pre-flight check!!

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Don't hog the intercom!'

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 'Keep your gloves on!'

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 'Check your masks!'

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 'Call out those fighters!'

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: â€˜Let's make this our best one yet!'

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "Right in the pickle barrel!' Laughter all around the plane.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I'm not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is behind his gun. He watches the sky from four to eight, high.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Danny boy, you didn't say what you're gonna do when it's all over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Clay, I don't really like talking about it. I mean, what if something happens... (hesitates) What I mean is, it just seems so far away, that's all. A silence as the men think about how far away the end of the war really is. Now Danny feels bad for spoiling the mood.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, guys. Suddenly, Eugene's voice calls out, sharply.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bandits, five o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene swings his gun towards the rear and aims at two tiny specks in the sky. He's already nervous, jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge spins his turret to five o'clock and sights in the fighters with his two big .50 calibers, excited and anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, calm as ever, puts down his penknife and model plane, takes hold of his guns and aims them at five o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke looks out his window. The Thunderbolts are peeling off to chase the fighters.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Go get 'em, little friends!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hold your fire till Gerry's in range. Don't waste ammunition.  152 153 154 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene OPENS FIRE at the fighters, still far away.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I said, hold your fire! Eugene stops firing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: That was Geenie the weenie. Jack laughs and looks at Eugene. Eugene fakes a kick to Jack's groin. Jack doesn't even flinch, he just laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thunderbolts and German fighters rush at each other at a combined speed of over 600 m.p.h., FIRING away. Just when the fighters seem about to collide, the Thunderbolts peel away and soar off into the sky. The M-109s keep coming. They're smaller and more sleek than the Thunderbolts, like cigars with wings. They can do anything they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is excited and eager; Eugene nervous and jittery.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're a-comin'.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Call them out.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Six o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nine o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Three o'clock high! Jack OPENS FIRE. So does Eugene. The room throbs from the vibration of the GUNS. SHELLS SPIT out onto the floor.  155 156 157 158 159 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny FIRES out of his little opening in the roof. He can't see much, just a piece of bright sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind the cockpit, Virge is FIRING his twin .50 calibers. The sound is deafening. Luke twists anxiously in his seat, trying to see what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, do your job. The gunners will do theirs.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Breaking low to five o'clock! Ball turret, look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal spins the turret and FIRES at a fighter zipping by at an incredible speed.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: That guy had blue eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are planes all over the sky. It's hard to tell who is who. Tracers streak the air. B-17s FIRE back. It's chaotic. The fighters are dazzling, flying rings around the bigger planes.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Keep calling them out!

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're leaving us alone.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're going after the first flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighters are converging on the three planes above, really giving them hell. Engine two of the lead plane bursts into flame.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Windy City's on fire!  160 161 162 163 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the nose we can see the German fighters soaring off into the sky, fleeing from the burning plane.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Why aren't they doing something? Are they asleep?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Bail out, you guys!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Come on, get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Jesus, there's a hole in the pilot's window! Suddenly, WINDY CITY EXPLODES in a huge ball of flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball of flame becomes a massive black cloud straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hold on, everyone! Luke braces himself. Dennis grips the control column as we fly straight into the huge black cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is filled with smoke, getting in Jack and Eugene's eyes. Eugene cries out.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Call in!

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tail.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Right waist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Left waist.  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke fills the ball turret. BITS of metal are PINGING against the Plexiglas. Rascal is jumping out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Ball turret! Get us out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is gripping the wheel, trying to control the plane as it's buffeted around in the black cloud.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Radio operator.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Top turret. There is a LOUD THUNK and the plane rocks.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Keep calling in! Suddenly, we come out of the black cloud into sunshine that seems twice as bright as before.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Copilot.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bombardier. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Navigator, call in! Navigator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is paralyzed, staring at the nose. It's covered in blood and the blood is streaming back from the tip in rivulets and freezing. Val hasn't seen it yet.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Phil! Phil!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Navigator. Sorry. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When I say call in, I mean right away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Val shakes his head in annoyance of Phil, then turns around and sees the blood.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Fuck! Somebody's guts are all over the nose!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Any damage? Crew, check your stations. The blood has frozen in a ring around the nose. It glints in the sun, horrible, but also weirdly pretty. Phil can't take his eyes off it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Nose okay.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Radio room okay.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Waist okay.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tail okay. Phil shakes himself out of his trance and turns back to his gun.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Call out those bandits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge spins his turret, checking the sky. It's peaceful, as if nothing had happened.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hit and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, C Cup and Mama's Boys draw closer together. Friendly fighters patrol the sky in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Captain, I just heard from C Cup. They're taking over the lead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Hear that, Val?

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: C Cup is lead plane now. When they drop their bombs, so do we.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Got it. Pause, then Dennis looks at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Any chutes from Windy City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene and Jack's faces are smudged with soot. Eugene's eyes are watering and he rubs them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Those guys didn't have time to pee their pants.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If you gotta go, that's the way.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Here one minute, gone the next.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Do we have to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is also greasy from the soot and he wipes it with his scarf.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Hey, I heard a good one from the waist gunner on Windy City. What was his name?

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cooley.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: I mean the left one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cooley!

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: I mean the right one.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I know the guy.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Tall guy.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not so tall.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Everyone's tall to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil extends the penciled line across the North Sea and above a string of islands skirting the northern coast of Holland, the Frisian Islands. We're approaching Germany fast. Again, Phil's hand shakes and his line isn't as straight as it should be.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Lindquist.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Virge, you're not even close. We DISSOLVE FROM the map TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real coastline, matching the map perfectly: the curve of Holland's coastline and the Frisian Islands.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Anyway... a plane gets shot down. This guy bails out. The Gestapo gets him. His leg's broken and they have to amputate...  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turns slowly in the turret, searching the sky below for fighters as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: He says, 'Do me a favor. After you cut it off, give it to one of your pilots and have him drop it over my base in England.' So they do it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rascal, don't tie up the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: This is real quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly revolves in the top turret, carefully watching the sky, listening.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A week later they have to take off the guy's other leg. Same thing. 'Could you have someone drop it over my base in England?' And they do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: notices that his camera has moved to the edge of his desk and is about to fall off. He grabs it just in time and pushes it to safety.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Next week, they've got to cut off his arm. He asks them again, 'Could you please have someone drop it over my base in England?! This time they say, (German accent) 'Nein. Zis ve can't do anymore.'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits a little forward to deliver the punchline.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: The guy says, 'Why not?' And they say, (German accent) 'Ve sink you're trying to escape!'  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of LAUGHTER from all over the plane. Luke is now flying the plane. Dennis is having more soup.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Pretty good, Rascal. I think even Dennis liked that one.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Stoller! That's his name.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No... no...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Stoller wasn't on Windy City.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Wait, it'll come to me.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I can see the guy's face.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Me, too. A long, bleak pause as they think about it. Then Rascal breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Well, whatever his name was, it's a good joke.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Okay, men, let's stop fooling around. The Gerries are out there. Let's look sharp. In the b.g., the Thunderbolts peel off from the formation

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Damn, are the little friends leaving already?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They sure know when to run out of fuel.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They ain't dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thunderbolts gather in a squadron above the formation (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Below, the grey sea ends in brown and green countryside. The Thunderbolts wiggle their wings, then drop away from the formation, one by one.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Navigator, give me a position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts to draw a line south-southeast, right into Germany

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Sir, that's the Third Reich down there.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now the shit really hits the fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is scrupulously neat, the desk clean and clear There's the loud TICKING of a CLOCK. It's unnaturally quiet -- none of the usual hustle and bustle of the base. The CO is sitting at his desk, sharpening pencils. The pencils are already as sharp as can be, but he continues to sharpen them, one after another. Suddenly, a RAP on the door and the S-2 enters. 8-2 Sir, you'd better come take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preparations are underway for a party. A banner is being hung from the ceiling: "CONGRATULATIONS MEMPHIS BELLE! 25 MISSIONS!" A stage is being set up, tables are being arranged, streamers are being strung. Bruce is arranging it all. The CO comes up to him. co What's the meaning of this? A couple of men are rolling in a piano.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: On the stage. Thanks. Just a little party, Colonel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: co I didn't order this.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Leave this stuff to me. The Memphis Belle's my job. co And my job is to approve everything on this base. I did not authorize a homecoming...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Craig, you work too hard at being ahardass. What's the harm in a little party in honor of these guys? They're special. co I have twenty-four crews up there. They're all special to me.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: That's great story, but bullshit's my business and I know it when I see it. All you care about is putting planes in the air. Results. Brown-nosing H.Q. The only man... The CO interrupts, grabbing Bruce's arm. co Come with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CO comes in, Bruce behind him. The CO is trembling with anger. He shouts at Bruce. co Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Craig, look... co Sit down! Bruce sits. The CO opens a bottom drawer and takes out a handful of letters. He puts them on his clean desk top. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: co Start reading. This one's from the mother of a boy who got his head blown off over Lorient. Start with that.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Craig, I think you're cracking up. co Read it! The CO gives him the letter. Bruce starts to read it. OVER, we hear the letter read by the voice of a FATHER. Bruce reads it casually at first, then little by little it gets to him, moves him. The CO puts another pile of letters on the desk, then another. They start to spill over onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dear Colonel Harriman, I want to thank you for your letter of sympathy about my son Tommy. He was only at your base a month, but he must have made a big impression because you described him right down to his boots. I wish you could have told me how Tommy died, but I understand we have to be careful about security these days. I'm glad he was brave and did his job to the end. Maybe his mother and I raised him right after all. I guess we'll get used to him being gone, but not too soon, I hope. Well, I can always read your letter and that will bring him back. Sincerely, Thomas R. Maguire. During the reading we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil behind his gun, watching for fighters, sweat dribbling down the side of his face and freezing. OVER, we continue to hear the LETTER READ, and then hear a second voice, VOICE of a SISTER READING another LETTER.  185 186 187 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal, on edge, cold, waiting for fighters. Another voice, VOICE OF A BROTHER, begins. The VOICES are LAYERED on top of each other. Now we can only pick up a word here, a phrase there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, behind his gun, worried, tense, looking up into his piece of sky for enemy aircraft. Then we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside of the plane. The Memphis Belle and its two wingmen. Then, as more and more VOICES spill on top of the others the way the letters spilled on top of the CO's desk. We CUT WIDER AND WIDER until the SCREEN is FILLED with the entire formation and the SOUNDTRACK is filled with the VOICES READING their LETTERS to the Commanding Officer, conveying the enormity of the air war -- each plane contains ten young, fragile lives, heading into battle. Abruptly, the SEQUENCE ENDS with --

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN FIGHTERS
dialogues.text: shoot through the formation like a swarm of angry bees. There are ME-109s and also FW-190s. These are fatter than the 109s and have blunt, snub noses similar to the Thunderbolts.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bandit, five o'clock low!

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Three o'clock high, too!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're all over the place!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don't yell on the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: See this guy at eight level? Left waist, see him?  188 189

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack eagerly aims at the fighter. One side of the sign on his back is unstuck and is hanging from his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I see him! Come to daddy! That's the way. That's the... He OPENS FIRE at the fighter coming in from the rear of the plane. As Jack swings his gun to the right to follow it, the wind catches the sign on his back and it flaps up into his face.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What the fuck? I had him! He was right there! Goddamit! He rips the sign off his shoulder and reads it. He can't believe it. He turns to Eugene, who is FIRING out his side and hasn't seen this. Jack's about to grab Eugene when Rascal's voice interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Here he comes around again, left waist! Jack, get the greedy bastard! Jack turns back to his GUN and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge pounds his GUNS at the fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay rattles his GUNS at a fighter up in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Phil are both FIRING out of their sides of the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene reaches up to touch his St. Anthony medal, but it's not there. Alarmed, he pulls off his oxygen mask and speaks to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: My medal! Have you seen it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack spies it on the floor, reaches down and picks it up -- the chain has broken.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Thanks. Eugene reaches for it. But instead of giving it to him, Jack angrily throws it out the window. Eugene screams.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Why'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Now we're even! Jack turns back to his gun.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Right waist? Right waist, call in! Radio operator, get back there and see what's happening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny pulls off his oxygen mask and pulls out his inter- com cords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny comes into the waist and Eugene grabs him. He's frantic.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: My medal, it's gone! I'm finished, Danny, I'm finished!

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Stop it, Gene! Wait! Danny quickly pulls off his glove and takes off the big red rubber band around his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Take my lucky rubber band. It really works. He puts it on Eugene.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You're okay now. Go get 'em. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Danny pats him on the back, then goes back through the forward bulkhead. Eugene looks at the rubber band and decides it's better than nothing. He puts his oxygen mask back on, gives Jack a kick in the butt, grabs his gun, sights in a fighter and starts FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fighter swoops down from above, FIRING away. C Cup is all that remains of the first flight.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 190, twelve o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He's going for C Cup. Look out, look out! The NOSE of C Cup SHATTERS. A man is blown out and starts to fall. No parachute opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val and Phil look down through the nose at the falling man.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Jesus, he doesn't have a parachute. How long would it take to fall?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Too long. Somehow, C Cup remains above. But the nose is gone and wires and equipment dangle from it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Everybody, make sure you've got your parachutes. Phil reaches under his desk for his parachute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal spins in the turret, looking for fighters.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Parachute? There isn't room for a hard-on in here!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I know, ball turret, but put your safety strap on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: It hurts.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Put it on! Rascal takes the strap, a thin strip of canvas, and puts it between his legs. He snaps it into place above. It's tight and uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is at his radio.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Captain, I just got word from C Cup. They're dropping out of formation. We're in the lead now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C Cup is losing speed and altitude. We start to pass it. It looks like a ghost ship. Dennis has again taken control of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Okay, Danny. Give me C channel to talk to group.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Poor bastards.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The bogeyman will get them.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bye-bye, C Cup. There is a sharp CRACKLE on the INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Sir, you're on to group.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: This is the Memphis Belle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Belle is now the lead plane, leading the entire group. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dennis is sobered by the responsibility of what he has to do. He speaks quietly, with humility, to the other captains.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We're lead plane now. I'll try my best to put those bombs right in the pickle barrel and get us out of here safe. I'm going to need all the help you can give me. Let's tighten up out there and be on our toes. We're three minutes, thirty seconds from the bomb run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val FIRES at a fighter coming in a little to the right.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Bloodsucker, nine o'clock level! Ball turret, watch out! Rascal starts to spin the turret around, but suddenly it sticks and won't move.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: I'm jammed! He's coming right at me! Virge, help! He stomps on the control pedal, but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge pulls off his oxygen mask, yanks out his intercom cords and jumps down from the turret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge runs down the narrow catwalk through the bomb bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is SHOOTING his GUN into the sky as Virge runs past him and through the aft bulkhead doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal stomps on the pedal again and again. Suddenly the turret unsticks, whirls around and Rascal FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIGHTER EXPLODES in a ball of flame.  205 206 207 208 209 210 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal screams at the fighter.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: And your mother, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge drops to his knees beside the turret, breathing hard. He looks at the top of the turret -- it's turning smoothly.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: What's his problem? Virge shakes his head in annoyance, then starts back towards the front of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGHTER appears out of nowhere, BUZZING down on the left, MACHINE GUNS BLASTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS RIP through the waist and Jack is knocked to the floor. His oxygen mask is ripped from his face.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Jack's hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is doing some adjustments to his instrument panel. Phil is FIRING out his side of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Val, run back and look at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Captain, I'm two minutes from the bomb run!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay. Gene, you're going to have to take care of him. Val is very relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene kneels beside Jack, who is squirming and yelling. Eugene tears open Jack's pant leg around the wound on his left thigh. Eugene pulls off his oxygen mask to talk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Jack, hold still! Let me look! Blood is already freezing around the wound. Eugene examines it. Then he starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Would you help?

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: It's a scratch! Look! It's nothing, and you're screaming like a stuck pig! Jack looks at his leg. Eugene's right, it's nothing. Then Jack sees his harmonica sticking out from his torn pant leg pocket. It's bent -- clearly it deflected the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My harmonica! Goddamnit, my favorite harmonica! Laughing, Eugene quickly wraps his flight scarf around Jack's leg, ties it, then pulls Jack to his feet. Then Jack reaches behind Eugene's ear and pulls out the St. Anthony medal. Eugene looks at it, astonished.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: How'd you do that? Jack smiles, sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Magic. Bugene takes the medal and beams at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters have disappeared. Everything is peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Keep calling 'em out.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Christ, you know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Flak, nine o'clock level! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's what I was afraid of. Black PUFFS start to blossom in the sky around the planes. They make a soft POOF as they EXPLODE. A red flame can be seen for a brief second in the center of each explosion. No sooner does the smoke start to dis- sipate than fresh puffs appear.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They've got something like 500 flak batteries around Bremen.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I could live without knowing that, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay is writing in the frost that has collected on the inside of his left window.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Clay, what're the odds of us getting out of here alive?

dialogues.speaker: CLAY
dialogues.text: I was just figuring that out. He writes "Three to One."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black PUFF EXPLODES not far from the turret and there's a SHARP BANG on the side of the turret. Rascal jumps.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ball turret, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: A big piece of ass fucking Nazi flak just hit my turret!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You guess or you are? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: I am. One of the little windows on the side of the turret has been knocked out. A frigid wind blows in. Rascal tries to plug it up with his flight scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The constant PATTERING CONTINUES, like metal rain.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I hope we're all wearing our flak jackets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene and Jack grab their heavy, bib-like flak jackets from the floor and struggle into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is putting on his flak jacket when the Rookie's voice comes OVER the RADIO. Danny glances out his right window at Mother and Country.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (nervously) Danny, quick question. This flak, it's not like I expected. Can't the captain do something, avoid it or something?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Not this close to the bomb run. You have to fly straight through or you'll be off target. It's just four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (nervous laugh) Just. Suddenly, a BANG and a hole opens in the left wall of the radio room and a small, SIZZLING piece of FLAK skates across Danny's desk, digs a scar in the wood and lands on top of his log book. It burns a little hole in the top page. Danny brushes the jagged, black piece of shrapnel away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're flying through a massive flak barrage. Constant PINGING and RATTLING on the outside of the plane. It's incessant, unnerving. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is the bomb run. We're exactly four minutes from target. Dennis puts his finger on the automatic pilot switch. It's on the control box below the throttles.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Bombardier, I'm turning on the auto pilot. You're flying the plane from here to delivery. He flips the switch. Lights flicker on the instrument panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is bent over the bombsight, making careful adjust- ments. He works with great concentration, ignoring the flak barrage that can be seen directly ahead through the nose.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Seventy thousand pounds of bombs are going to drop on your command. I want pinpoint bombing.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Pinpoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black smoke is smeared all over the sky. Puffs appear constantly. The RATTLING on the outside of the plane has grown LOUDER. It doesn't give you a moment's peace.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Christ, I've never seen it this thick before. Suddenly, a LOUD BANG and blood sprays all over the cock- pit. The instrument panel, windshield, Dennis and Luke are drenched.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke's hit! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Dennis is hit! Virge rips off his oxygen mask and jumps down from the top turret to look at them.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Jesus! Dennis and Luke examine themselves: Dennis rationally, Luke in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It's not me. It must be you.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It isn't me!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (to Virge) I think he's in shock.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'm not in shock! You're in shock!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Val, you better get up here fast.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm on the fucking bomb run! Virge sees something on the floor and reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It's not me.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Me, either!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: It's got to be somebody. There's blood all over the cockpit. Virge picks up Dennis's Thermos off the floor, cut in two

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Tomato soup. He starts to laugh. It takes Luke a moment to get over his terror, but then he starts laughing, too. Dennis is relieved. Then, suddenly, an incredible BANG and the plane rocks violently. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There's a hole as big as my dick in the left wing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hole is about two feet in diameter. It's between engines one and two. Gas is leaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The needle on one of the fuel gauges is sinking.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: We're losing fuel!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Virge, get on the fuel transfer pump . Virge turns around, bends down and flicks the transfer levers.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: The electrics must be out on the left side. The pumps aren't responding. I'll do it by hand.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, work with him. We've got to save as much fuel as we can. Virge runs into the bomb bay.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Two minutes to target.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Let's drop those bombs and get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val pulls a lever on his control panel on the left side of the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Bomb bay doors open.  222 223 224 225 226 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is standing on the narrow catwalk at the front end of the bomb bay, working the fuel transport pump switches when the bomb bay doors start to open. He looks down at the ground, so far below. Suddenly, a flak SHELL BURSTS right below the bomb bay. There's a frantic CLICKING as pieces of SHRAPNEL HIT the bombs. Virge looks through the bomb bay into the radio room and meets Danny's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val takes his eye from the bombsight and looks out the nose. Although the day is perfectly clear, the ground ahead is covered with low-lying white smoke.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Bombardier to Captain. The target's covered. Looks like a smoke screen. Val flips down the safety latch on the bomb release button. It's on the left side, next to the bomb bay door control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge comes out of the bomb bay.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Fuel transport complete. We saved some of it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Bombardier, how's that target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houses, a river and the beginning of the smoke screen. There are two crosshairs which Val manipulates with course knobs on either side of the bombsight.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.8S.)
dialogues.text: Target totally obscured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val flips some switches and sets a couple of dials on the control panel. He does this with quick precision, then looks through the sight again.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds to delivery.  227 228 229 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flak is still pummeling the outside of the plane. Black smoke is smeared all over the sky. The plane wobbles.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Bombardier, I need those bombs on target. The whole group is bombing with us.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If I can't see, I can't see. Dennis reaches down and puts his hand on the auto pilot. Luke looks at him in shock.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We came here to bomb a factory. We're going to bomb a factory even if it means going around again.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? You go around on a bomb run, that's like sending out an engraved invitation to the Nazis to blow us away!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, I'm in command!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val puts his finger on the bomb release button.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Dennis, what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: ON PHIL
dialogues.text: At his desk, watching Val, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis has taken his finger off the auto pilot switch.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Bombardier, give me a report.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Visibility zero. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dennis reaches for the switch.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You do it and we're dead. Dennis flips the auto pilot to "off."

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: We're going around again.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Danny, give me C channel again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val takes his finger off the bomb release button and adjusts the bombsight. Phil lunges for the button. Val sees him out of the corner of his eye and grabs Phil's hand just before he can push it. He shoves Phil back, then snaps the safety catch back on the button. Phil sits in his chair, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Belle banks into a sharp turn to the left. Baby Ruth and Mother and Country follow.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It'll take us five minutes to get back to the start of the bomb run. Navigator, give me a postition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is sitting at his table, but unable to work, to focus.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Navigator, did you hear me? Phil looks up and meets Val's gaze. They look at each other a long moment. Then Phil turns back to his maps.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He tries to pull himself together and begin to work.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis banks out of the turn and straightens out the plane.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Everybody listen. I know you want to drop the bombs and get the hell out of here. But there's civilians down there, there's a school right next door and if we don't get these bombs right in the pickle barrel, a lot of innocent people are going to be killed.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: They're all Nazis, what difference...?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, shut up! Luke glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Eugene are both listening. Eugene clutches his St. Anthony medal, the broken chain dangling.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don't want to go around again any more than you do. But we were sent here to bomb a factory and if we don't do it, somebody's going to have to come back here again and do it for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAK is BURSTING right outside Rascal's turret and PATTERING against it. He's shivering from the cold blowing in the broken window.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nobody promised us it would be fun and games. It's our job. Ours, nobody else's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay looks at the odds he wrote on the condensation on his side window: 3 to l. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If we do it right, it's something we can be proud of our whole lives. That's all I want, believe me. With a swipe, he wipes them away. All bets are off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke has not taken his eyes off Dennis.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Now, let's get back to work, stay alert and call out those fighters soon as you see them. Silence. The flak has stopped. Dennis feels Luke's stare and looks over at him. They exchange a long, long look, then Dennis breaks it. Suddenly, Virge calls out.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bandits, three o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane has straightened and Baby Ruth and Mother and Country have closed in tight beside it. A squadron of fighters appears high in the sky, queued up, ready to come in. They dive down at the formation, one after another.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock, too!

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Two of them, coming in at eight.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don't like being in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yep, we're the piece of shit the flies are headin' for.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Here they come, here they come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal spins the turret and starts FIRING.  240 241 242 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Eugene and Jack open up, FIRING out of their sides of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNS are FIRING all over the plane. Virge's GUN throbs right behind the cockpit. Luke is jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bandit, twelve o'clock high! Cockpit, look out, he's heading straight for you! Luke looks up in terror at the fighter zooming in at him, FIRING away.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do, spit at him? Luke ducks his head down, as the FIGHTER BUZZES right at them. Dennis doesn't even glance up. The fighter passes overhead. Luke comes up from his tuck. He's jumping out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Tail gunner, how are you doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jus' fine, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Let me know if you need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay calmly FIRES at a fighter barrel-rolling under the Belle. It's already on fire.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY
dialogues.text: Sure will. But I'm doin' just... He hesitates. He remembers. Then, a little too obviously:

dialogues.speaker: CLAY
dialogues.text: Oh, right, Lieutenant! I do need some help back here!  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke pulls off his oxygen mask, yanks out his intercom cord and starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Tail gunner, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm runnin' out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Can't somebody else do it? Right waist, left waist?

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Captain, we got fighters all over us back here.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Dennis, I'm the only one not doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (a beat; then) Okay, but make it fast. Luke steps over the control box, squeezes past Virge and heads into the bomb bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke goes past Danny, who's FIRING up into the sky, then through the aft bulkhead doorway. From here we see Luke go the length of the plane to the tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is bent over the bombsight, making adjustments, turning dials. Phil takes off his mask to talk. So does Val.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Val, I'm sorry. I don't know what's wrong with me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You're a coward, that's what's wrong. A big fucking coward and you're in real trouble when we get back down on the ground. Now leave me alone and let me do my job! Val refastens his mask and turns back to the bombsight. Phil turns back to his maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke comes into the tail and changes places with Clay. He kneels in front of the guns with Clay behind him, watching over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 190 breaking to ten o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Another one, high at three. Radio operator, hear me?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Gotcha. Thanks, Virge. Luke looks around for fighters, but none are in sight.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A speck appears way down below, dodging through the formation at a fantastic speed. Fortresses FIRE at it, but it keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tail gunner, see that bandit at seven low? He's all yours, Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke eagerly aims his guns down at the approaching plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighter keeps coming. It flips over on its back and zooms toward the Belle's tail, MACHINE GUNS BLASTING.  251 252 253 254 255 256 257 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke OPENS FIRE. He follows the fighter up past the tail. At first it looks like Luke missed it. Then the FIGHTER STALLS, stopping dead in the air above. Smoke starts streaming from its belly, its nose drops down and it starts a slow fall to the right.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I got him! I got him! Whooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighter falls right into Mother and Country. The fighter's left wing slices off the B-17's tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke watches with horror.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Country's tail section tumbles toward the ground with the fighter.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's the rookies! They got the rookies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks out the right side window, alarmed. Then he flips a switch on his radio.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Memphis Belle to Mother and Country! Come in, come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of Mother and Country drops down and two men roll out. For a moment, Mother and Country hangs in the air like a big cross. Then it plunges toward the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny frantically works the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Mother and Country come in! He flips a switch. On the RADIO, we hear SHOUTING and SCREAMING, complete chaos. Danny listens with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke watches, horrified, as Mother and Country falls. He's stunned, paralyzed by what he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Country plummets to the ground, spinning as it goes, like a giant arrow. Then it hits the ground with a quick flash and a little plume of smoke. When it hits, the RADIO GOES DEAD. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sits there a moment, shocked by the suddenness of it. Then he starts to move to his position behind his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay grabs Luke by the back of his jacket and pulls him up and shoves him out of the way. Then Clay falls to his knees before his GUNS and STARTS FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How many chutes from Mother and Country?

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I saw two.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, two.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY'S WHITTLED MODEL PLANE
dialogues.text: sitting in a sea of spent cartridges. It's crushed. In the b.g. we see Luke's back as he starts slowly toward the front of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he's out of the tail and into the tail wheel area, Luke stops and leans against the fuselage wall. Tears come to his eyes. He tries to hold them back, but can't. He's overcome with remorse for what he has done. He finally realizes the horror of war. He struggles to pull himself together. Then he starts towards the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is alone in the cockpit. PHIL'S VOICE comes over the INTERCOM.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Captain, this is the bomb run.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Bombardier, I'm turning it over to you.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Roger. Dennis flips the auto pilot switch to "On." Dazed, Luke squeezes past the top turret, climbs into the cockpit and sits in his seat. Dennis pulls off his oxygen mask to talk.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, right after delivery, on our way to the rally point, I'm going to take some evasive action and try to avoid this flak. Be ready on rudder.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Dennis. You know what you're doing. Dennis looks at him, astonished by this response. Luke turns away to hide his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground is almost visible, still covered with smoke. A patch of green or a piece of river can be seen for an instant, but that's all.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bombardier, how does the target look?

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Like shit.  264 265 266

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes his eye from the bombsight, pulls the bomb bay door lever, then flips up the latch on the bomb release button. He catches Phil's eye, who is on his gun, very near the button. Phil looks at Val a moment, then turns back to watch for fighters. Val looks through the bomb- sight again.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Captain, I still can't see a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his finger hovers over the auto pilot switch.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Bandit, three o'clock high. Top turret, see him?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I see him. He's a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ball turret, watch this guy on the left. He wants your ass.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He ain't going to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: puts his finger on the bomb release button.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bandit coming in twelve level. Coming right at the nose!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I'm on him.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 'Nother one at two low, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Thanks, Gene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing we can see is thick, rolling smoke. The crosshairs intersect at perfect right angles.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Dennis, my sight says we're over the target. I've got to do something. What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis's finger is on the auto pilot switch. His hand trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRES his GUN with one hand and rubs his lucky horseshoe with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kisses his St. Anthony medal as he FIRES at a FIGHTER BUZZING in on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: finishes firing off a round, then reaches inside his cuff for his lucky rubber band, but it isn't there. A flash of panic. Then he remembers he loaned it to Bugene. He looks through the rear bulkhead door and can see Eugene. Danny's relieved his rubber band isn't far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is frozen, eye to the bombsight, finger on the bomb release button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the smoke thins a little, revealing the top of a@ square grey building, directly at the intersection of the crosshairs.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: To the briefing where the target photo is projected large on the screen. The S-2's pointer taps the factory three times. It's the same building.  275 276 277 278 279 280 281 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: jerks his head up from the bombsight and shouts, excited.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: That's it! That's it! Bombs away! (presses the bomb release button) Right in the pickle barrel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bombs start dropping from the racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bombs fall from the bottom of the Belle. Bombs also start to fall from Baby Ruth and the other planes in the group. Bombs are dropping all over the sky. Then they hit the ground. Flashes, then billowing clouds of grey- black smoke. It's an unforgettable, frightening sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis watches the delivery from his side window. Then he reaches down and flips off the auto pilot.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, we've done our job for Uncle Sam. Now we're flying for ourselves. He turns the control wheel. There are WHOOPS of joy all over the plane -- they did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holding on as the plane tips into its turn. Eugene holds up his St. Anthony medal. Jack gives him the thumbs-up sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil reaches out and pats Val on the back, but Val angrily shakes him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bombs are still falling. The target is a mass of fire and smoke. The Belle banks into a turn. Baby Ruth follows.  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNS are again POUNDING all around the plane. Jack is FIRING, following a fighter from ten o'clock high to nine low.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Gerry breaking low to nine o'clock. Ball turret, watch it, watch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal pushes on the foot pedal to swivel the turret, but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: I'm stuck! Virge! He's coming right at me! Virge! Virge! The fighter is zooming in right at him, firing. Rascal stomps on the pedal, but still nothing happens. The fighter keeps coming, keeps firing. Rascal's eyes widen in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HUGE EXPLOSION and the plane rocks violently.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Call in! Virge pulls off his oxygen mask, yanks out his intercom cord, jumps down from the top turret and charges into the bomb bay.

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tail.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Right waist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Left waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is frantically FIRING up into the sky as Virge comes running through.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ball turret! Ball turret, call in!  286 287

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicky, Virge falls to his knees beside the ball turret, opens the hatch and looks down into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: down into the turret. The bottom of the turret is gone and Rascal is dangling twenty thousand feet above the ground, held by just the strap between his legs. He's holding onto the top of the turret and the force of the slipstream is blowing his legs toward the back of the plane. He's out of his mind with terror. He reaches for Virge. Virge grabs his hands and pulls him, with difficulty, out of the narrow hatch on the top of the turret. Rascal is shot up a little. Virge quickly checks him, but the wounds look superficial. Rascal is shaking and crying.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: You're okay, Rascal. You're safe. You're okay. Rascal grabs Virge and hangs onto him. Virge holds him, pats his back, trying to comfort and calm him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are FIRING frantically out of their sides of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is FIRING, too, humming a little as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: finishes FIRING a round, then swings his gun around to fire at another fighter. As he does, he sees that his camera has again moved to the edge of the desk and is just about to fall. Quickly, Danny reaches for it and catches it just as the camera falls off the edge. Relief. Just then, a CANNON SHELL bursts through the roof of the radio room and EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is jolted harder than ever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Call in!

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge and Rascal have been thrown to the deck by the explosion. They scramble to their feet and go through the forward doorway into the radio room.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Right waist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Left waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is on fire. Danny lies face-down on the floor. Virge pulls him away from the flames while Rascal grabs a fire extinguisher and turns it on the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighters are everywhere. FLAK is still PUMMELING the outside of the plane. Virge comes out of the bomb bay and crouches down behind Dennis and Luke.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Danny's hurt.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Val, Danny's hurt. Get back there right away and see what you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOPS FIRING his GUN. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: How bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I guess he needs help pretty badly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 296A
dialogues.text: lll.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Val doesn't go. He hangs onto his gun. Phil rips off his oxygen mask and yells at Val.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: What are you doing? It's Danny!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I can't. There's fighters all over.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I'll cover your gun. Just go!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Maybe somebody in the back of the plane could...

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: You're the fucking doctor!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (panicky) That's just it. I'm not. Phil, I lied about it. I only had two weeks of medical school before I enlisted. I don't know anything. Phil drags him toward the back of the nose, grabs the first aid kit off the wall and shoves it into Val's hands.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Just do it! Val starts to go up the hatch to the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIGHTERS are still BUZZING around. Luke is silent and grim.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, don't worry. Danny'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It's such a waste. The whole fucking... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stops, unable to put into words his feelings. Dennis tries to think of something to say to make him feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire is out. Val, Virge and Rascal gently turn Danny over. His oxygen mask was ripped off in the explosion. He's pale and still. Val opens his jacket. There is an ugly, open wound in his upper chest below his shoulder. Val stares, paralyzed with fear. Then he opens the first aid kit and takes out a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis speaks quietly, comfortingly to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Luke, don't take the world on your shoulders. You didn't start the war. All we can do is try to do our best. We're not perfect. When this is all over, we'll go back home...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (looking out window) Fire on number three!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Cut fuel, feather prop. Fire extinguisher. Luke quickly turns the engine three feathering switch on the instrument panel, then pulls the turbo supercharger control and closes the throttle, both on the control box. Suddenly, BULLETS RAKE across the instrument panel. GLASS and sparks fly as Dennis and Luke cringe. Half the instrument panel is shot out.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Call out those fighters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
