dialogues.text: The prop on engine three slows, then stops, edges facing into the wind. But the fire still burns and now it's spreading to the wing itself.  300 301 302 503 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is again crouched behind Dennis and Luke. Luke is finishing the feathering procedure, flipping the shutoff valve to closed and the booster pump to off.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Danny's in bad shape.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: How's Rascal?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: He's okay.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Prop feathered, but the extinguisher's not working. If we don't do something quick we're going to lose the wing. Dive!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Okay, but I'm going to need you to pull out of it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Crew, I'm going to dive and try to blow this fire out. Everybody hang on! He depresses the control wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane begins to plunge, leaving Baby Ruth behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's and Eugene's feet go out from under them. They're suddenly weightless. Eugene hangs on to his gun, but Jack loses his grip and is slammed against the ceiling. Shell casings fill the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is lifted up along with anything that isn't nailed down: his log book, pencils, compass, maps, ammunition.  304

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is tipped at a forty-five degree angle. Rascal holds Danny. Val has the needle in Danny's upper arm. The plane is vibrating violently. The needle breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the airspeed indicator as the needle creeps toward 300 m.p.h.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Luke are both holding their control wheels. Dennis is monitoring the airspeed, Luke watching the burning engine.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: 275. We're exceeding maximum diving speed. We better level her.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: The fire's not out. Just a little more.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: A little more and we could lose the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Trust me. A few seconds more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the flame on engine three blows out.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Luke pull back hard on their control wheels. The plane shudders violently as if it's going to rip apart. Luke and Dennis strain to control it. They're working together now as partners, no need for words. The plane starts to pull out of the dive. After it levels, Dennis pulls off his oxygen mask and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Crew, we're at ten thousand feet. We can come off oxygen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luke pulls off his mask.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Thanks, Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Once in a while I do something right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is just finishing injecting Danny with morphine. He pulls out the needle. Rascal, Virge and Eugene are gathered in the radio room. Danny is still unconscious and his breathing is shallow. There are occasional BURSTS OF GUNFIRE from the front and rear of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I don't know what else to do. He's lost a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: How far is it to base?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: On three engines? Two hours, maybe two and a half.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Two and a half hours! He'll never make it.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: Val, help him!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (panicked) What do you want from me? He needs a hospital! I've got a stupid first aid kit! Val turns away.

dialogues.speaker: ON EUGENE
dialogues.text: Eugene suddenly sees that he still has Danny's lucky rubber band on his wrist. He never gave it back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He leans against the doorway, trying to hold back his tears.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: turns back to the others. He's very frightened. He's grasping at straws and trying not to lose control.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: There's one more thing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: What? Let's do it!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: We can put a parachute on him... and push him out. The others react with shock.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Val!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It's crawling with Germans down there. He'll get picked up by the Germans and they'll take him to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: If they don't kill him for fun first!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Rascal, it's his only chance! Another crew did it. This gunner lost an arm...

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that guy was conscious.

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Danny couldn't even pull the cord.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: We can pull it first and put the chute under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: He could fall in a lake and drown!

dialogues.speaker: EUGENE
dialogues.text: Val, can't we wait? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: We'll be over the North Sea in ten minutes. Then it'll be too late.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: If we're going to do it, we've got to do it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is flying the plane. Phil and Val are in the cockpit, crouched behind Dennis's and Luke's seats. Val is fighting down his hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Val, I'll go along with anything you say. You're the doctor. Phil looks at Val. Val avoids his glance.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: We just don't have a choice, Dennis. We've got to do it.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: All right. Tell the men that's my decision and I don't want any argument. Val starts to return to the bomb bay. Phil follows him through the top turret and stops him on the threshold of the bomb bay. The bomb bay doors open, revealing the ground so far below. The enlisted men are gathered around Danny at the other end of the bay. They have put a@ parachute on him and tucked the chute under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Please don't do it, Val.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It's his only chance.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: No, you're his only chance, but you're too goddamn chicken to help him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: If he stays on board, he'll die.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: He's going to die if you throw him out. And you know that. A long pause. Val is trembling with fright. He looks at Danny. Phil pleads with him, desperately.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Val, you can save him! So, you're not a doctor, so what? You can help him, I know you can. Don't give up.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Phil, I'm scared!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: No, you're not. You're not scared. Phil turns Val around and looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: You're Val. Val looks at him a long, long moment.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Now go help Danny. Val takes a breath, nods and starts toward Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some SOFTBALL PLAYERS are playing a game. There are men on second and third. The batter steps up to the plate and the pitcher pitches. The ball is right over the plate, but the batter doesn't even try to swing. His teammates yell at him, angrily. He points out at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SOFTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first three planes appear in the distance.  313 314 315 316 317 318 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men are starting to gather on the lawn in front of the control tower. Bruce is giving instructions to the Life photographer.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: What I want is a picture of them running towards the camera, throwing their hats in the air, going crazy, the plane in the background. We might have to do it a few times to get it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les wakes at the sound of a PLANE ROARING overhead. He looks at his watch. It's 4:45. He gets up and starts pulling on his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first plane is landing. A two-pronged red flare pops out of the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les joins the rest of his ground crew. The Softball Players are counting the planes as they appear.

dialogues.speaker: SOFTBALL PLAYER
dialogues.text: Seven!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PLAYER
dialogues.text: Hight, nine!

dialogues.speaker: THIRD PLAYER
dialogues.text: Did'ja get that one? We MOVE UP TO the control tower balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CO joins the S-2 on the balcony. The S-2 is watching the sky with binoculars. co How many so far? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 8-2 Nine, sir. There's another one. Ten. co The Belle? 8-2 Not yet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is alone over grey sea. Oil is spitting out of the first engine on the left side of the plane and heavy, dark smoke is twisting out of it. The propeller reverses directions, slows, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We're running on two engines now. Let's lighten up. Throw out everything you can. We're close enough to home so you can lose your guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack takes out the bolt that attaches his machine gun to its mounting, then picks up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, Mona... we didn't get a fighter after all. Eugene picks up his gun and looks at Jack for a long moment. Then Eugene throws his gun out the window. Then Jack throws his out and watches it fall. Clay comes in from the tail with his guns slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil throws some flak jackets out of the nose hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is very pale. His eyes flutter a little.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The Belle is sitting on the ground. Phil is asleep on the wing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The other guys are listening to Danny recite his poem.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: 'I balanced all, brought all to mind, The years to come seemed waste of breath, A waste of breath the years behind, In balance with this life, this death.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny suddenly opens his eyes. He's panicked. Val leans over him.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yeats!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It's okay, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I didn't write that. It's by W.B. Yeats. I couldn't write that. Val strokes Danny's forehead. He doesn't know what Danny's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Danny becomes calmer. He closes his eyes. Then he starts to shake. Val tucks Danny's jacket around him tighter, but the convulsions only get worse. Val feels Danny's pulse, then lifts one of his eyelids. Danny's eye is turned up into his head.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Danny! Danny suddenly stops shaking. He lies still. Val pulls the jacket away and puts his head down to Danny's chest.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: No! Panicked, Val doesn't know what to do. Out of desperation, he pounds Danny in the chest with his fist. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Don't do this! Goddamnit, Danny! Don't do it to me! He pounds him again. Danny gasps.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: One more! Give me one more! Danny gasps again and starts to breathe. Val listens to his chest. He hears a heartbeat. Val looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You try that again and I'll kill you. He puts Danny's jacket over him again and tucks it in tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead we can see the white coastline of England. Virge crouches down behind the control box.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Ain't that a pretty sight?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: How's Danny? Virge crosses his fingers. Then Virge looks up in the sky and gasps.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Fighters! A whole squadron, twelve o'clock high! A sqaudron of fighters have appeared directly ahead, aimed straight for the Belle.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Look alive, men. Fighters, twelve o'clock high!

dialogues.speaker: CLAY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (calmly) What do you want us to do about it, Captain? You had us throw out our guns. A flicker of panic in Dennis's eyes. Then Luke puts a hand on Dennis's shoulder. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Relax, Dennis. They're little friends. Dennis looks up at the fighters, then breathes a sigh of relief. The sound of the other crew members WHOOPING with delight all around the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furthest ENGINE on the right side of the plane starts CHOKING and the propeller begins to slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sees this out his window.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: We're losing number four.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Are we out of fuel? Luke looks at the shattered instrument panel.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: The gauge is shot out. How long can we fly on one engine?

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess we'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is clear of planes. Les is still standing with the ground crew, but other men have given up hope and are walking back to the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke's DOG is lying on the grass. Bruce is patting him on the head, but the dog isn't interested. Then suddenly, it raises its head and BARKS. Bruce jumps back, afraid he'll get bit. The DOG runs past Bruce and BARKS out at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: with the ground crew, looking anxiously out at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CO is on the balcony with the 8-2. The ADJUTANT comes up to the CO.

dialogues.speaker: ADJUTANT
dialogues.text: Sir, Headquarters on the phone. co I'll call them back.

dialogues.speaker: ADJUTANT
dialogues.text: Sir, it's General... co I don't care who it is, I'll call them back! The CO raises his binoculars and looks out at the plane.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: The Belle, flying very low, barely clearing the treetops, just Engine One still turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The base is visible ahead. Virge is crouched between Dennis and Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Landing gear. Luke flips a switch on the control box, but there's no electric whine. He looks out his window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Something's wrong. My wheel didn't come down.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: (hesitates, then) Okay, pull them back up again and we'll belly land. Luke flips the switch again, but there's silence -- no electric whine.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening. He flicks the switch back and forth. He looks out his window again.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Nothing's coming up, nothing's going down.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: The electrics must be totally out! A moment of terror as the three men look at each other. They remember the plane the day before that landed with one wheel -- and blew up.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Can you lower the wheel by hand?

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Okay. Get some of the other men to help you. Luke, monitor the wheel and tell me when it's down. Virge runs through the top turret and into the bomb bay. Dennis flips a switch on the lower wall by his knee. A loud ALARM BELL RINGS. Luke loads a flare gun.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Take positions for crash landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugene and Rascal are gently moving Danny into a position so that Val can protect him from the crash. Jack and Clay are taking crash landing positions. Virge rushes in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Jack, help me! He grabs a small handcrank from the aft bulkhead wall and then runs into the bomb bay, Jack and Clay right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is straddling the bomb bay catwalk and turning the landing gear hand crank quickly. Jack and Clay are standing on the catwalk behind him, each waiting his turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The right wheel slowly starts to descend from the belly of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is holding the control wheel tightly as he starts to point the plane towards the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane brushes the tops of the trees at the end of the runway. A two-pronged red FLARE SHOOTS out of the Belle's cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AMBULANCE DRIVERS are standing by their ambulance. They see the flare.

dialogues.speaker: AMBULANCE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Wounded aboard! Let's go! They quickly hop into the ambulance cab.  343 344

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les, with the ground crew. In the background, men are coming from all over the base to watch the plane land.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: My God, they've only got one wheel down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge is exhausted from turning the crank. He steps aside and Jack takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The right wheel is very slowly creeping down. It has a long way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The runway is ahead. Dennis is gripping the control wheel tight as he aims the plane for the runway. Luke is fastening his seat belt when there's a sudden jolt, then complete silence. Luke looks out the left window.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: We lost Number One! The plane suddenly loses altitude, the nose dips down and points straight at the runway. Dennis pulls at the control wheel.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Flaps! Luke spins the flap controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge hears the silence and knows what happened. He shouts at Jack.

dialogues.speaker: VIRGE
dialogues.text: Hurry! Jack turns the crank faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels are extended further, but still not enough to land on.  347 348 349 350

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Val is cradling Danny, to protect him from the crash. The others are braced against the bulkhead walls. Eugene's praying as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Belle dives for the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les watches, muttering under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Come on, baby, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CO grips the railing, with white knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is gripping the control wheel as the plane dives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is exhausted, out of breath. He's turning the crank slower and slower. Phil shoves him out of the way and takes over the crank, turning it as fast as he can. He talks to himself as he does.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: We're not going to die. It's okay. We're not going to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when it looks certain to crash, the nose of the Belle lifts, the landing gear pop out with an audible CLICK and hit the runway, hard. The plane bounces into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew is jolted. Danny wakes. He looks up at Val, panicked, not knowing where he is or what's happening.  355 356 357 358 359

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane tips to the right and looks like it'll come dow on its right wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis wrestles with the control column. Luke works the flap controls. They're instinctively a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane straightens and lands. The flaps come up and the plane goes onto the grass, throwing dust into the air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men on the lawn cheer. They surround Les and the ground crew and congratulate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clay, Rascal and Eugene cheer and ruffle Danny's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virge, Jack and Phil realize that they made it and shout with excietment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane comes to a stop at the far end of the runway. The ambulance races towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CO lets go the railing, relieved. He turns to go back inside. The Adjutant takes a step back, a little afraid of him. But the CO smiles, pats the Adjutant's arm affectionately, then goes inside -- back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rascal opens the waist door. The Ambulance Drivers are there. He steps aside and they enter the plane, carrying a stretcher, a medical kit, an IV bottle.  363 364 365 130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer is snapping pictures. Bruce yells at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I don't want that Goddamn ambulance in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis and Luke quickly flip off the power and fuel controls.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Wing flaps.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Up.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Tail wheel.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: DENNIS
dialogues.text: Generators.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: off. They're finished. Silence. They don't know what to do with themselves. Then Luke unhooks his seat belt and gets up and goes through the top turret into the bomb bay. But Dennis just sits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is conscious, pale, but looking better. He's hooked up to an IV, which Val holds. The rest of the crew is with them, under the nose of the plane. Danny clutches his camera.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: One picture, Danny, then straight to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (weakly) You're the doc. Val smiles. Bruce starts arranging their positions while the photographer sets up his tripod. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Let's have the officers in the center. Luke, I want you down front...

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Bruce, just take the picture. He takes Danny's camera and tosses it to Bruce. Bruce catches it, too surprised to object.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Where's the captain?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Yeah, where is Dennis?

dialogues.speaker: RASCAL
dialogues.text: We've got to have Dennis in the picture. Dennis appears around the nose of the plane. He holds the bottle of champagne. He walks towards the crew, a grim expression on his face. The crew shifts uneasily. Dennis stops right in front of Danny and looks at him. Danny thinks he's in big trouble. Then, suddenly, Dennis whoops with joy and pops the cork. Champagne spurts out and Dennis douses the crew with it. The crew is amazed -- this is a new Dennis. They laugh, try to duck the suds, and Bruce takes the picture. FREEZE FRAME. The picture FADES TO black and white as a LEGEND ROLLS OVER it.

dialogues.speaker: LEGEND
dialogues.text: The air war over Europe lasted six years. 353,000 young men lost their lives. OVER the credits we see more of the pictures Danny took: at the dance, in the barracks, in the plane -- his permanent record of the last mission. FADE OUT.
